result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas Jeffery Munson

records.addlTxt: Forwarded to Clerk DA for review

10:28 AM Defendant Lucas Jeffery Munson appeared by video, in custody OZSD.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that the public defender is still looking for an appointment. Defendant's family has retained Atty Lloyd for his Manitowoc case only.  Court continues to find good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Doc for review to clerk DA

10:16 AM Defendant Lucas Jeffery Munson appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant that the public defender's office has not yet been able to appoint counsel. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. Defendant states his family received a letter stating an Atty Larry Lloyd was appointed.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .

No contact with: co-defendants S.S. and T.T.   Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

1:21 PM Defendant Lucas Jeffery Munson appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran appearing as a friend of the court in court for Lucas Jeffery Munson.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant does qualify for PD representation, due to conflict case will be appointed out. Court finds probable cause. State requesting $2500 cash bail with conditions. Counsel requesting to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sheriff dispatch advises defendant is in custody.
arrest warrant, forwarded to br. 3 dashboard
